This is an Atom formatted XML site feed. It is intended to be viewed in a Newsreader. Alternatively you can view the HTML archives at https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk/cgi-bin/webadmin?A0=BMLA.
LISTSERV Web Interface 2.4.1 2014-10-16T07:43:08Z Williamson Matt 2014-10-16T08:42:13+00:00 2014-10-16T08:42:13+00:00 Re: Laser Machine https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;1b054052.1410 Lisa<br>Have you contacted the local trading standards office. The issues of lease can complicate the situation.<br><br>I have looked at the company web site and at face value they seem to offer the issues you are after, eg training risk assessment, etc.<br><br>There is a range of products from RF, ipl and laser combos available from them. [...] Bill Davies 2014-10-15T22:43:17+01:00 2014-10-15T22:43:17+01:00 Re: Laser Machine https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;85972055.1410 Hi Lisa<br>Leasing is a complicated contractual arrangement but as far as I know the<br>leasing company usually takes all responsibility for the goods or services<br>provided. It would then be the leading company's responsibility to ensure<br>you have the correct goods or services.<br>I hope that your solicitor will be able to sort this out.<br>Bill [...] Steve 2014-10-15T20:28:26+00:00 2014-10-15T20:28:26+00:00 Re: Laser Machine https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;7b47e73e.1410 What make and model is your laser?<br><br>Best regards<br><br>Steve<br><br>------ Original Message ------<br>From: "L BOURNE" <bourne650@btinternet.com><br>To: BMLA@jiscmail.ac.uk<br>Sent: 15/10/2014 17:47:52<br>Subject: Laser Machine<br><br>>Dear Sir/Madam,<br>><br>>At the beginning of September I purchased a laser machine via a leasing<br>>company.<br>>It came to me with NO labelling, incorrect glasses and no training<br>>which they were meant to provide, this has left the machine useless to<br>>me, I have not been able to trade and I have many losses, the owner of<br>>this laser machine company has not done a thing to correct any of this<br>>and the [...] L BOURNE 2014-10-15T17:47:52+01:00 2014-10-15T17:47:52+01:00 Laser Machine https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;27d6de41.1410 Dear Sir/Madam, At the beginning of September I purchased a laser machine via a leasing company. It came to me with NO labelling, incorrect glasses and no training which they were meant to provide, this has left the machine useless to me, I have not been able to trade and I have many losses, the owner of this laser machine company has not done a thing to correct any of this and the leasing company are still wanting their money even though I cannot trade. I have now had to get a solicitor as this machine is unfit for purpose, [...] Williamson Matt 2014-10-15T14:31:04+00:00 2014-10-15T14:31:04+00:00 EN207 eye protection standard vs medical slit lamps in ophthalmic lasers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;633a59f2.1410 In the EU we use the EN207 and 208 standards for protective eye wear.<br><br>In clinical use the slit lamp in ophthalmology laser systems, will have a built in filter for the necessary wavelength.<br>Like all the others I have seen, The new system I inspected last week had a built in back reflection filter which was labeled OD4 @ 532nm and 1064nm. [...] Cotton, Angela 2014-10-13T13:13:44+01:00 2014-10-13T13:13:44+01:00 Core of Knowledge course 9 February https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;54f5c653.1410 The next Southampton laser safety course (medical and surgical applications) will be held on Monday 9 February 2015.<br>For further information please contact:<br><br>Angela Cotton<br>Head of Non-Ionising Radiation Support<br>Radiation Protection<br>Medical Physics Department<br>Mailpoint 29<br>Southampton General Hospital<br>Tremona Rd<br>Southampton<br>SO16 6YD<br>tel 023 8120 8616<br>fax 023 8120 4117<br>angela.cotton@uhs.nhs.uk<mailto:angela.cotton@uhs.nhs.uk><br><br>Disclaimer<br><br>This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential and intended solely for the use of the individual or entity to whom they are addressed.<br>Any views or opinions presented are solely those of the author and do not necessarily represent those of the [...] Catherine Kendall 2014-10-09T18:58:29+01:00 2014-10-09T18:58:29+01:00 BMLA approved Laser Safety Course THURSDAY 13th NOVEMBER 2014 Gloucester https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;f0125d22.1410 Dear all<br>I would like to bring our forthcoming BMLA approved Laser Safety Course to<br>your attention.<br><br>LASERS & INTENSE LIGHT SOURCES SAFETY COURSE<br>THURSDAY 13th NOVEMBER 2014<br>REDWOOD EDUCATION CENTRE, GLOUCESTERSHIRE ROYAL HOSPITAL<br><br>The course aims to provide the delegates with an understanding of the<br>operational safety requirements concerning lasers, intense light sources and<br>IPL equipment, the medical uses of lasers, their physical properties and<br>associated hazards, by covering the new syllabus of the \ufffd\ufffd\ufffdCore of<br>Knowledge\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd dated July 2014 which has been approved by the British Medical<br>Laser Association, Institute of Physics and Engineering in Medicine and the<br> [...] Matthew Beattie 2014-10-08T19:22:44+01:00 2014-10-08T19:22:44+01:00 Pulsed Dye Laser Treatment of Paediatric Port Wine Stains - Invitation to Participate in a UK Nationwide Survey https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;15efa88.1410 Dear BMLA Member,<br><br>My name is Dr Matthew Beattie, and I am conducting some research into the<br>pulse dye laser treatment of paediatric port wine stains.<br><br>If you are involved in this practice, I kindly ask you to complete a very<br>short one page survey, available here: PDL Treatment of Paediatric PWS<br>Survey <http://goo.gl/forms/C3n2WFznCG>. It should take no more than 2<br>minutes to complete. [...] IPEM Conferences 2014-09-22T11:04:55+00:00 2014-09-22T11:04:55+00:00 IPEM October Conferences and abstract submission opportunities https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;9b38b9f5.1409 [cid:image001.jpg@01CFD658.4C86C300]<br><br>Please note the following registration deadlines and abstract submission deadlines for some of our forthcoming conferences. Click on the conference titles for more details.<br><br>CALL FOR PAPERS DEADLINES<br><br>Optical Radiation Update<http://www.ipem.ac.uk/ConferencesEvents/ForthcomingConferences/EventDetails.aspx?dateid=289><br>28 Nov 2014, Bath<br>This meeting provides an update for scientists and technologists working with lasers and UV sources and is an excellent opportunity to exchange experiences and ideas and to network.<br>Call for Papers deadline: 26th September [...] Catherine Kendall 2014-09-12T10:51:23+01:00 2014-09-12T10:51:23+01:00 TSB funded Post-doctoral research fellow post - Biophotonics Research Unit Gloucester https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;63f14897.1409 Dear all<br><br>I would like to draw your attention to a Post-doctoral research fellow<br>position which is currently available in the Biophotonics Research Unit<br>GHNHSFT to work on a TSB (Technology Strategy Board) funded project SMART:<br>Stratified Medicine through Advanced Raman Technologies. This is a full time<br>(37.5 hours per week) Band 7 (\ufffd\ufffd30,764 - \ufffd\ufffd40,558) post. [...] bill davies 2014-05-20T10:46:29+00:00 2014-05-20T10:46:29+00:00 Invitation to connect on LinkedIn https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;c66c9352.1405 LinkedIn Harry Moseley 2014-04-29T09:22:35+00:00 2014-04-29T09:22:35+00:00 scanner https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;aad3a69c.1404 Dear list<br><br>We have an old Laserscope Aura KTP laser that has given us many years of faithful service. Sadly, the scanner is no longer working. It is not repairable and a replacement is unavailable.<br><br>This site cannot be used for commercial purposes and so this is a call to someone out there who has a Laserscope scanner that they no longer need. Would you be willing to agree to a free recycle? We will happily arrange and pay for transport. [...] Tom Lister 2014-04-22T15:32:26+01:00 2014-04-22T15:32:26+01:00 Raman Spectroscopy for Skin Cancers https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BMLA;9169e3bc.1404 Dear List,<br><br>Over the past few years, I've become increasingly interested in the optical diagnostics work that I keep seeing at the BMLA/Laser Europe conferences. So much so, in fact, that I'm hoping to introduce something similar in Salisbury.<br><br>Looking at the services we have available, and the work that has been done elsewhere, I am currently thinking about introducing a skin cancer diagnostics service which employs Raman spectroscopy. [...]
